text: Mario Sentell Giden Mims (born May 19, 1981 in Memphis, Tennessee), better known by his stage name Yo Gotti, is an American rapper, songwriter, and record executive. He founded the record label Collective Music Group. The label's current president is Yo Gotti's cousin, Brandon Mims. The label includes artists Blac Youngsta, BlocBoy JB, Moneybagg Yo, 42 Dugg, EST Gee, Mozzy, and others. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== Yo Gotti released 8 studio albums: Year Album Peak chart positions Certifications 2003 Life (No. 59; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums) 2006 Back 2 da Basics (No. 84; Billboard 200, No. 6; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 3; Top Rap Albums) 2012 Live from the Kitchen (No. 12; Billboard 200, No. 4; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 4; Top Rap Albums) 2013 I Am (No. 7; Billboard 200, No. 2; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 2; Top Rap Albums) RIAA: Gold 2016 The Art of Hustle (No. 4; Billboard 200, No. 1; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 1; Top Rap Albums, No. 82; Canadian Albums) RIAA: Gold 2017 I Still Am (No. 6; Billboard 200, No. 4; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 3; Top Rap Albums, No. 74; Canadian Albums) RIAA: Gold 2020 Untrapped (No. 10; Billboard 200, No. 6; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 6; Top Rap Albums) 2022 CM10: Free Game (No. 3; Billboard 200, No. 2; Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums, No. 2; Top Rap Albums) ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website * Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Rappers from Tennessee Category:Musicians from Memphis, Tennessee Category:American hip hop musicians Category:21st-century American rappers
title: Yo Gotti
